p: Our analysis finds a strong relationship (R 2 = 0.74) between increases in growing season average air temperature and reductions in NONSTRESS yield ( Fig 6a). When only domain averages are analyzed, the correlation becomes even stronger (R 2 = 0.91; Fig 6b). The regression suggests that for every 1Â°C warming during the growing season, Iowa can expect a 3.0% reduction in non-moisture-stressed maize yield.
